author: kvprasoon
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases"
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Below output is of 6.1.0-Preview.2

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12897753/42962631-af80eef2-8baf-11e8-8960-9bc556839dbd.png)


Actual behavior
---------------

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12897753/42962665-bf415c6e-8baf-11e8-89b9-c9550e359541.png)


Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16299 
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0



```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @kvprasoon I can not repo with latest builds.

comments.author: kvprasoon
markekraus
comments.body:
@kvprasoon are you sure it's not a connectivity issue between your servers and github?

if you enable TLS 1.2 and run the same commands on 5.1, do you get the same result?

comments.author: kvprasoon
markekraus
comments.body:
Right, but does it work in 5.1 still after the upgrade (enabling TLS 1.2 before trying)? Since you can run 5.1 and 6.1.0 side-by-die, I'm trying to establish where the fault is. So I'm asking you to test it in 5.1 on the same machine where it is failing with 6.1.0. Can you confirm, please?

I ask because I am unable to reproduce this anywhere. Since the underlying .NET Calls also fail, I suspect this is a system/environment issue. This kind of error can occur if you have networking tools between the client (CoreFX) and the server. These could be anything from firewalls, monitoring software, silent proxies, proxies, intrusion detection, antivirus, etc.

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body:
I think its because of proxy, even with 5.1 i'm facing issues. I have tested the same in another Win 10 and works fine.
Thanks @markekraus .

comments.author: hurricanehrndz
comments.body: I have this same issue, and definitely going through an IPS. To add though, it seems like 6.0.4 works without issue. I'm just testing against the releases url as well.

title: Invoke-WebRequest fails to establish connection
